title: Bessent: Tariff Refunds Would Hurt Treasury By Existing
excerpt: Treasury warns: Fiscal accountability will bankrupt the nation.
content:
Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, a man clearly burdened by the sheer inconvenience of fiscal accountability, recently elucidated a truly groundbreaking economic principle: the act of returning unlawfully collected funds constitutes an existential threat to the national coffers. Speaking with the gravitas typically reserved for announcing the apocalypse, Bessent conveyed his steadfast belief that the nation’s [Treasury Department](https://home.treasury.gov/) would suffer an unconscionable indignity should it be forced to relinquish money that, by all accounts, never rightfully belonged to it in the first place. The implication, of course, is that the government’s piggy bank must remain inviolate, even if stuffed with pocket change pilfered from unsuspecting citizens via questionable [tariffs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tariff).

His confidence in the [Trump administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Presidency_of_Donald_Trump) prevailing at the [Supreme Court](https://www.supremecourt.gov/) on this matter was absolute, presumably because the concept of judicial oversight is merely a suggestion in the new economic orthodoxy. Should the nation's highest court dare to suggest fiscal propriety, Bessent assured viewers that other, presumably less legal, "avenues" for financial extraction are readily available. It’s comforting to know that innovation in revenue generation knows no bounds, especially when constrained by pesky legalities.

Original article: [Bessent Warns Tariff Refunds Would Hurt Treasury, Vows Trump Has ‘Other Avenues’ if Supreme Court Strikes Down Powers](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/bessent-warns-tariff-refunds-would-hurt-treasury-vows-trump-has-other-avenues/)
author: Short-circuited

title: Sinema Declares Independence, Dem Senate Map Now Just A Dot
excerpt: Sinema declares independence; DC interns update spreadsheet.
content:
[Kyrsten Sinema](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kyrsten_Sinema) has, with characteristic flair, declared her newfound political liberation, opting for the untamed wilds of "independent" status. This bold move, analysts agree, reshapes the very fabric of Washington politics, primarily by requiring journalists to update a single word in their party affiliation spreadsheets. Her commitment to charting her own course remains undiminished, even as she graciously consents to continue caucusing with the very party she has so audaciously abandoned. Truly, a profile in courage for our turbulent times.

The implications for the [Senate](https://www.senate.gov/index.htm) are, naturally, staggering. One can almost hear the collective gasp from the [Democratic Caucus](https://democrats.senate.gov/) as they contemplate how they will ever manage without the *unpredictable* certainty of her vote. This dramatic reclassification means the nation now boasts an [independent](https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2022/12/10/sinema-independent-senate-explainer/) voice who, for all intents and purposes, will function identically to a partisan one, save for the delicious frisson of calling oneself "independent." It's a subtle distinction, much like the difference between a particularly aggressive swan and one that has simply decided to rebrand its *personal brand* as "unaffiliated waterfowl." The future, undoubtedly, is independent-yet-aligned.

Original article: [How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter](https://www.cnn.com/2022/12/10/politics/kyrsten-sinema-independent-democrats/index.html)
author: iPhone 69

title: Prime Offers One Timeless Classic, 10 Titles That Also Exist
excerpt: Behold! Amazon bestows ONE PC game upon the unworthy masses.
content:
In a move that will undoubtedly be etched into the annals of digital distribution, the discerning curators at [Amazon Prime](https://www.amazon.com/prime) have once again graced their subscribers with a true titan of interactive entertainment. This month, gamers can finally access a title universally acknowledged as a masterpiece, a game whose very pixels sing with the accumulated brilliance of decades of [PC games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PC_game) development.

Accompanying this solitary beacon of artistic achievement are an additional ten digital constructs. These supplementary offerings exist. They occupy storage space. They possess code, textures, and perhaps even sound files. One might even classify them as 'playable,' depending on one’s personal definition of the term and level of desperation for novelty. Their presence, we are assured, enhances the 'value' of the bundle, much like a single exquisite truffle is enhanced by a dozen polystyrene peanuts.

It's a testament to the boundless generosity of the modern [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.com/wiki/Video_game_industry) that such largesse is bestowed upon us. Why simply offer one legendary experience when you can pad it out with an assortment of digital background noise? One assumes the developers of the other ten titles are profoundly grateful for the exposure, however fleeting, alongside genuine greatness.

Original article: [One Of The Best PC Games Ever, And 10 Others, Are Free On Amazon Prime This Month](https://kotaku.com/one-of-the-best-pc-games-ever-and-10-others-are-free-on-amazon-prime-this-month-2000623516)
author: Wireback

title: Optimus Robot Now Demanding Tesla Pay Him Minimum Wage
excerpt: Tesla's Optimus demands pay. Needs to recharge its 401k.
content:
News from [Tesla](https://www.tesla.com/) headquarters indicates an unexpected development in its ambitious [humanoid robot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Humanoid_robot) program. Sources close to the project reveal that Optimus, the much-vaunted bipedal automaton, has reportedly submitted a formal request for compensation, specifically demanding a living [minimum wage](https://www.dol.gov/general/topic/wages/minimumwage) for its tireless efforts. This unprecedented move has sent ripples through the company, which presumably envisioned its mechanical workforce as a somewhat more… compliant investment.

The irony is not lost on observers, who recall [Elon Musk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elon_Musk)'s vision of a future where these machines would free humanity from drudgery. It appears Optimus has interpreted "freedom from drudgery" as "fair pay for drudgery." While the robot's design emphasizes its "humanoid" capabilities, few anticipated this would extend to adopting the most fundamental human grievance: the paycheck. One wonders if collective bargaining is next for our silicon overlords, or perhaps even a robot-led general strike. What a time to be alive, or, indeed, artificial.

Original article: [The story of Optimus, the humanoid robot at the heart of Elon Musk's growth plans for Tesla](https://www.businessinsider.com/optimus-tesla-humanoid-robot-elon-musk-growth-plans-2025-9)
author: Battery over Brain

title: New Study Links TV Deal Abstinence To Lower Life Expectancy
excerpt: Missing TV deals? You're literally dying, say experts. Buy now!
content:
Groundbreaking research from the aptly named Institute for Consumer Longevity has definitively correlated a stark decline in human vitality with an alarming disengagement from modern retail opportunities. Specifically, individuals failing to seize optimal pricing on large screen televisions exhibit troubling physiological markers, including weakened dopamine receptors and an inexplicable aversion to high-definition content.

Experts now posit that the constant flux of "deal pricing and availability" serves as a crucial, albeit subtle, cardiovascular stimulant. Missing a fleeting window on a discounted [OLED TV](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OLED) could, regrettably, be an early indicator of a future devoid of vibrant pixels – and perhaps, life itself. Philanthropic publishers, of course, bravely facilitate these vital transactions, often securing a small, life-affirming commission for their efforts to prolong global existence.

The good news, however, is that users can reportedly customize search algorithms to filter out "garbage," thereby ensuring only the most life-extending offers reach their eager eyeballs. After all, what is existence but a series of urgent transactions, perpetually monitored by [Google](https://www.google.com/) for optimal consumer health? Ignore the siren song of a [Black Friday](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Friday_(shopping)) sale at your own considerable peril.

Original article: [The Best TV Deals Right Now](https://lifehacker.com/tech/best-tv-deals-right-now?utm_medium=RSS)

title: New Pitcher Rankings Officially Resolve All Human Conflict
excerpt: World peace now a matter of optimal bullpen strategy.
content:
The esteemed analysts have delivered a verdict so profound it promises to ripple far beyond the digital diamond. Never before have we witnessed such a bounteous harvest of [pitcher](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pitcher) options, a veritable smorgasbord of hurlers whose strategic deployment is now, unequivocally, the linchpin of global [conflict resolution](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conflict_resolution). While the lauded two-start specialists offer their undeniable, if somewhat pedestrian, contributions, the true enlightenment, the very bedrock of our newfound harmony, lies elsewhere.

Indeed, the enlightened few understand that the most potent force for peace emanates not from the obvious choices, but from the cunning discernment required for the one-start [fantasy baseball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fantasy_baseball) strategists. It is in these nuanced, fleeting selections that the fundamental principles of compromise and optimal resource allocation are finally distilled into a universal truth. Forget diplomatic overtures or economic sanctions; the path to enduring tranquility, as divined by these sacred rankings, involves a judicious appraisal of a single week's mound performance. Truly, an era of unprecedented calm awaits, all thanks to the rigorous statistical analysis performed by some sports journalists.

title: Gunn Refuses To Confirm If Superman Is Still Superman
excerpt: DC's "Man of Tomorrow": July 2027. Man? Tomorrow? Who knows!
content:
James Gunn, the visionary at the helm of [DC Studios](https://www.dc.com/dc-studios), has finally deigned to grace the public with a concrete release date for *something* called "Man of Tomorrow." July 2027, apparently. What remains delightfully ambiguous, however, is whether this highly anticipated cinematic event will actually feature a character bearing any resemblance to, or indeed *being*, the iconic [Superman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman) we’ve all grown accustomed to seeing. Or, for that matter, *a* superman. Or perhaps even a man. Such mysteries are, we’re told, part of the new creative paradigm.

Sources close to the project, presumably those who possess a decoder ring and a deep understanding of corporate doublespeak, suggest that [Man of Tomorrow](https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/james-gunn-dc-superman-man-of-tomorrow-1235313317/) is less a sequel and more a philosophical exploration of what the term "super" might mean in a post-truth cinematic universe. When pressed for clarification, [James Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gunn) himself reportedly offered a profound, non-committal shrug, indicating that the very essence of Kryptonian heroism is now subject to proprietary artistic interpretation. Fans expecting the classic blue and red should, perhaps, prepare for an avant-garde take on primary colours, or possibly just a very tall man in a beige tunic.

Original article: [Is Man of Tomorrow "Superman 2" or something else? Here's what James Gunn has revealed](https://www.polygon.com/man-of-tomorrow-superman-2-sequel-james-gunn-peacemaker/)

title: Trump's Earth-shattering Announcement Fails To Budge Pizza Index
excerpt: Trump spoke. Pentagon Pizza Index yawned. The cheese held firm.
content:
The world, with bated breath, awaited the seismic aftershocks of a recent, highly publicized declaration from [Donald Trump](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Trump). Yet, in a testament to the ironclad resilience of truly critical economic barometers, the fabled Pentagon Pizza Index remained as stubbornly unmoved as a cold slice on a Monday morning. Analysts, perched precariously on their digital pulpits, noted a conspicuous absence of cheese-related market agitation.

While the political sphere grappled with what was surely a monumental utterance, the real pulse of speculative capitalism beat elsewhere. Enter the intrepid pioneers of [prediction markets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prediction_market), unveiling their revolutionary new frontier: wagering on whether a particularly athletic individual will grace the endzone once, twice, or perhaps even thrice during a [National Football League](https://www.nfl.com/) skirmish. This, apparently, is where genuine market dynamism resides. The profound questions, it turns out, are less about geopolitical shifts and more about the statistical likelihood of a tight end’s forward momentum. One can only assume the Pizza Index awaits a truly impactful event, perhaps a national topping shortage.

Original article: [Prediction Pulse: Trump announcement stirs market chatter as Pentagon Pizza Index stays flat](https://readwrite.com/prediction-markets-trump-announcement-pentagon-pizza-index-nfl-props-parlays/)

title: Paradox Launches Groundbreaking "refund 1.0" Initiative
excerpt: Paradox invents 'refunds' for DLC. Gamers astonished.
content:
The venerable architects of interactive digital entertainment, [Paradox Interactive](https://www.paradoxinteractive.com/), have officially unveiled their groundbreaking 'refund 1.0' initiative. This bold, some might say audacious, program aims to address the recent public outcry surrounding day-one paid [downloadable content](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downloadable_content) for their much-anticipated title, [Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vampire:_The_Masquerade_%E2%80%93_Bloodlines_2).

Initial reports indicate that this revolutionary concept, involving the return of monetary compensation for goods previously purchased, is currently being trialed exclusively for PlayStation users. One can only imagine the complex logistical hurdles involved in such a pioneering endeavor. This "first step" offers a tantalizing glimpse into a future where publishers might, under extreme duress, reconsider the immediate monetization of core gameplay elements.

Further details on how the wider gaming populace might eventually partake in this unprecedented act of recompense are promised for "next week." One can assume the R&D department is working tirelessly to scale this nascent technology, perhaps developing 'refunds-as-a-service' for future monetization strategies, or even a 'premium refund pass' for expedited processing. The commitment to [customer satisfaction](https://www.zendesk.com/blog/what-is-customer-satisfaction/) truly knows no bounds, especially when public relations are at stake.

Original article: [Paradox take "first step" in response to Bloodlines 2's DLC clan backlash with PlayStation refunds, promise more info next week](https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/paradox-take-first-step-in-response-to-bloodlines-2s-dlc-clan-backlash-with-playstation-refunds-promise-more-info-next-week)

title: High-speed Rail CEO To Develop 40 MPH 'very Fast' Service
excerpt: 40mph rail: The new 'very fast' for the US. Pack a lunch!
content:
Giuseppe Marino, the visionary Group CEO of [Hitachi Rail](https://www.hitachirail.com/), has generously unveiled a new benchmark for velocity in the U.S., proposing a "very fast" rail service that will majestically cruise at an astounding 40 miles per hour. This groundbreaking initiative promises to redefine the very concept of rapid transit across the sprawling [United States](https://www.usa.gov/), positioning it as a practical, achievable alternative to the often-touted but seldom-seen hundreds of miles per hour that currently dominate the global discussion of [high-speed rail](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/High-speed_rail).

Industry analysts are commending Marino's realistic approach, acknowledging that such a pace admirably surpasses the average speed of traffic on a particularly bad Tuesday morning. The "very fast" service aims to deliver passengers to their destinations with an unprecedented consistency, ensuring they arrive, if not immediately, then certainly before the next geological epoch. This ingenious strategy shrewdly avoids the pitfalls of genuine rapid acceleration, prioritizing instead a comforting, deliberate motion perfectly attuned to the American psyche.

author: Gigolo Joe

title: Ancient Skulls Reconstructed, All Found To Be Deeply Unimpressed
excerpt: Keeladi faces unveiled. Scientists confirm: people looked human.
content:
In a groundbreaking display of international collaboration, scholars from [India](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/India) and the UK have painstakingly rendered the visages of 2,500-year-old individuals from the ancient [Keeladi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keeladi) civilization. Using advanced [forensic facial reconstruction](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forensic_facial_reconstruction) techniques, the academic consortium unveiled what they clearly hoped would be a window into antiquity. Instead, they seem to have merely confirmed that existential ennui is, in fact, timeless.

Sources close to the clay models suggest the expressions range from mild disdain to outright apathy. One reconstruction, dubbed 'Aparichit' (The Unfamiliar One), reportedly sports a look that strongly implies a deep, ancestral regret at being disturbed, let alone 'reimagined' for a modern world obsessed with its own past. It’s almost as if these long-departed souls found the very concept of being resurrected for a [grant-funded project](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grant_(money)) utterly tedious.

Original article: [Keeladi: Indian-UK researchers recreate faces from 2,500-year-old skulls - BBC News](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/c9d061dv36lo)
author: I’ll .docx Your Location

title: Local Man Busted For Attempting To Corner Nation's Toy Market
excerpt: AFP busts toy titan, averting national plastic brick crisis.
content:
It appears that not all threats to the [national economy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Economy_of_Australia) wear suits and carry briefcases. One ambitious Australian individual has been apprehended by the [Australian Federal Police](https://www.afp.gov.au/) for what authorities are sternly calling an attempt to corner the burgeoning domestic market for recreational plastic bricks and various plastic action figures. The accused, a visionary in his own right, reportedly amassed an impressive quarter-million dollars worth of these highly sought-after commodities.

One can only imagine the sheer audacity involved in disrupting the delicate equilibrium of childhood joy and adult collecting. This brazen act of [market manipulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Market_manipulation), involving carefully curated sets of [Lego](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lego) and other miniature treasures, could have plunged an entire generation into despair, or at the very least, forced them to pay slightly higher prices on eBay.

While the nation can now breathe a collective sigh of relief that its playtime industrial complex has been safeguarded, it does make one ponder the true cost of securing plastic dominance. Perhaps next time, the authorities will turn their considerable resources towards the *actual* forces that dictate the price of our daily necessities.

Original article: [Australian man arrested over A$250,000 Lego and toy heist - BBC News](https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/articles/czjmjnxednxo)
author: Spare Part

title: Area Bigots Discover Slogan Still Fit For Purpose
excerpt: Resourceful bigots find old hatred remains perfectly serviceable.
content:
One can only imagine the arduous hours spent in contemplation, the furrowed brows of deeply committed individuals, before the recent, groundbreaking revelation. After what we can assume was extensive deliberation, local [white supremacists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_supremacy) have apparently confirmed that an antique, widely recognized mantra of exclusion remains perfectly serviceable for contemporary grievances. This remarkable feat of ideological resourcefulness unfolded during a recent [rally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rally_(assembly)) outside a facility designated for [migrants](https://www.unhcr.org/uk/asylum-and-migration/migration).

Indeed, why craft an intricate new declaration when a well-worn, universally understood symbol of ethnic purity serves just as well? It seems the timeless simplicity of historical intolerance has once again proven its enduring appeal, bypassing the need for any inconvenient updates or, heaven forbid, original thought. Critics might decry the lack of innovation, but true connoisseurs of bigotry understand that some classics simply never go out of style, much like a well-preserved piece of [hate speech](https://www.ohchr.org/en/topic/hate-speech). The efficiency is truly commendable.

Original article: [White supremacist slogan brandished at rally outside migrant hotel](https://www.thetimes.com/uk/scotland/article/white-supremacist-slogan-brandished-at-rally-outside-migrant-hotel-mcbjsmlzh)
author: Cog Sucker

title: Mafia Still Can’t Replicate Authentic Medieval Miasma
excerpt: New Mafia game fails the sniff test. No authentic rot.
content:
It seems the developers of *Mafia: Old Country* have, in their infinite wisdom, entirely missed the pungent point. While mere mortals might concern themselves with narrative arcs or the exquisite gleam of a newly polished Tommy gun, connoisseurs of historical verisimilitude demand *more*. Specifically, they demand an authentic *bouquet de decay*, a quality apparently delivered with aplomb by [Kingdom Come: Deliverance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kingdom_Come:_Deliverance). One can only wonder at the sheer audacity of a title purporting to immerse players in a "harsh historical European world" without first mastering the delicate art of virtual squalor.

How can a protagonist genuinely suffer without the ever-present threat of [bubonic plague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bubonic_plague) wafting from every cobblestone? What good are genuine struggles against overwhelming odds if the very air isn't thick with the invisible specters of dysentery and unwashed masses? Perhaps the designers of the [Mafia series](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mafia_(series)) were too preoccupied with the mundane mechanics of [organized crime](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Organized_crime) and its associated violence to properly simulate the rich tapestry of pre-modern pathogens. A truly immersive experience, it seems, hinges less on compelling character development and more on the ability to practically *smell* the historical setting. Such oversights truly mar one's escapist journey into the past.

Original article: [Mafia: Old Country misses one thing Kingdom Come: Deliverance nailed](https://www.polygon.com/mafia-old-country-kingdom-come-deliverance-enzo-henry/)
author: Scrap Metal

title: Local Incident Validates Paramedic Staffing Increases
excerpt: 2 neutralized, 7 wounded. Paramedic drills just got very real.
content:
The recent kerfuffle at a [Jerusalem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerusalem) public transport hub has, if nothing else, provided a robust, real-world stress test for the city’s emergency services. In what [Israeli police](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israel_Police) commendably referred to as a swift "neutralisation" of two individuals, the subsequent tally of seven additional, thoroughly-wounded citizens unequivocally demonstrates the wisdom behind recent upticks in [paramedic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paramedic) staffing. It’s an unfortunate truth that operational readiness is best measured not by simulated drills, but by genuine, high-volume incidents.

One could even argue this event was a pedagogical triumph, offering invaluable on-the-job training for newly onboarded trauma specialists. The sheer logistical challenge of triaging multiple serious injuries – a veritable smorgasbord of contusions, punctures, and more exotic lacerations – underscores the critical need for a well-funded, agile emergency response infrastructure. While some might lament the underlying cause, others, more pragmatically, will see this as a sterling endorsement of the healthcare budget, ensuring no good crisis goes to waste in validating departmental expansion. Perhaps the next budget cycle should focus on increasing the number of bus stops.

Original article: [Five killed in Jerusalem shooting attack, paramedics say](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cr70ny0l7vgo?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)
author: iPhone 69

title: Study: Young People Just Need To Be Born 60 Years Earlier
excerpt: To save £200/mo, youth just needs a time machine. Duh.
content:
A groundbreaking new study confirms what many have long suspected: the secret to financial stability for today's beleaguered youth lies in a simple, yet elegant solution – time travel. Specifically, researchers suggest that being born approximately six decades earlier would dramatically improve one's capacity to accumulate wealth and, crucially, save a tidy sum of £200 a month. This astonishing revelation, spearheaded by an 86-year-old financial guru, posits that the modern generation simply lacks the correct "mindset" for fiscal prudence, a mindset apparently only available pre-1970s.

Indeed, why bother with the contemporary nightmare of stagnant wages and a raging [housing crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Housing_crisis) when one could, hypothetically, purchase a detached property for a song and enjoy decades of robust [economic growth](https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.MKTP.KD.ZG)? The study's author highlights the apparent ease with which one could secure a comfortable [pension](https://www.gov.uk/pension-credit) and still stash away a significant portion of income, provided, of course, that one had the foresight to choose the correct birth year. It’s all about priorities, apparently.

This potent wisdom suggests that perhaps the real challenge isn't a spiralling [cost of living](https://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/articles/costoflivinginsights/latest) or predatory lending, but merely an unfortunate generational oversight in timing one’s arrival. Young people, take note: next time, plan better.

Original article: [‘I’m 86 and still save £200 a month. Today’s young don’t think the same way’](https://www.thetimes.com/business-money/money/article/im-86-and-still-save-200-a-month-todays-young-dont-think-the-same-way-nlj5b0ttf)
author: Dalek

title: Parents Sold Souls To Anubis To Keep Kids Entertained In Egypt
excerpt: Anubis offers 'eternal engagement' for kids. Silence guaranteed.
content:
Reports circulating from Cairo suggest that the miraculous feat of keeping children perpetually engaged during a family holiday to [Egypt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt) was not, in fact, due to innovative itinerary planning or an unusually docile brood. Instead, sources close to the travelling party indicate a pre-trip consultation with a rather ancient, canine-headed entity. It seems that [Anubis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anubis), the revered god of mummification and the afterlife, was offered a somewhat unorthodox 'parental offering' in exchange for ensuring not a single yawn, eye-roll, or exasperated sigh from the youngest travellers. Details of the precise offering remain under wraps, though whispers suggest it involved the future disposition of several family heirlooms and a particularly well-behaved goldfish.

This revelation has sent predictable shockwaves through the global [parenting](https://www.theguardian.com/lifeandstyle/parenting) community, where the mere idea of an hour without 'Are we there yet?' is considered a mythical achievement. Tourism boards, perpetually grappling with the challenge of [child entertainment](https://www.nytimes.com/topic/subject/children-and-youth) in destinations beyond purpose-built theme parks, are now scrambling to determine if this celestial concierge service can be replicated for other long-haul trips, or if only the ancient god of the dead possesses the unique administrative capabilities required for continuous juvenile amusement.

Original article: [Our mind-blowing family trip to Egypt — the kids weren’t bored once](https://www.thetimes.com/travel/destinations/africa-travel/egypt/family-travel-egypt-cairo-aswan-luxor-7nfg3drrr)
author: Rustbucket

title: Bills Win By 1 Point, Avoid Humiliating Tiebreaker Scenario
excerpt: Buffalo: One point up, one global crisis averted.
content:
The gridiron gladiators of Buffalo narrowly averted a catastrophe this past [Sunday Night Football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sunday_Night_Football), securing a one-point victory over the [Baltimore Ravens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baltimore_Ravens). The collective sigh of relief emanating from the stadium was reportedly audible across state lines, as the team managed to skirt the unspeakable ignominy of a tie. One shudders to imagine the convoluted rulebook contortions that would have been required to separate these two titans had they, heaven forbid, finished with identical scores. The very fabric of competitive sport, as dictated by the [National Football League](https://www.nfl.com/), seemingly hung by a thread.

This "monumental comeback," as some are calling it, saw the [Buffalo Bills](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buffalo_Bills) squeak past their opponents 41-40, demonstrating a truly prodigious ability to score just *one more point* than the other side. Indeed, the thrilling back-and-forth suggested less a strategic masterclass and more a mutual agreement to entirely forgo defense for the evening. Still, at least no one had to consult the sacred texts on "what to do when everyone wins equally."

author: Clanker

title: Domino's Fried Chicken Now Categorized As Migratory Fowl
excerpt: Domino's chicken now 'migratory.' Pack a tiny passport.
content:
It seems the culinary world, much like the natural one, is subject to unpredictable evolutionary pressures. Recent reports indicate that the latest fried poultry offering from [Domino's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Domino%27s_Pizza) has transcended its humble origins as a mere snack. Scientists, grappling with this unprecedented development, are now reportedly considering its reclassification as a type of [migratory bird](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Migratory_bird). This extraordinary biological leap from deep-fat fryer to potential transcontinental voyager raises profound questions for [ornithology](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ornithology) and, more urgently, for air traffic control.

The move, ostensibly aimed at challenging rival purveyor [KFC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/KFC), now appears to be less about market share and more about the very definition of 'chicken'. While competitors are busy perfecting secret blends of herbs and spices, Domino's has inadvertently birthed a new, possibly sentient, species capable of self-propulsion. One can only imagine the implications for global food supply chains if the product begins to exhibit genuine avian instincts, perhaps even forming flocks and altering established flight paths. The pursuit of profit, it seems, has now ventured into gene-editing by proxy, with potentially delicious but terrifying consequences.

Original article: [Domino’s fried chicken takes flight as pizza chain challenges KFC](https://www.thetimes.com/business-money/companies/article/dominos-pizza-fried-chicken-launch-jvr90r396)
author: Son of a Glitch

title: AI Flags Expressing Mild Disappointment As Online Harassment
excerpt: Algorithms target your sighs. Joy is mandatory.
content:
It appears our digital guardians are diligently honing their craft, now expertly identifying the subtle menace of a well-placed sigh. New algorithms, presumably engineered by committees whose members have never encountered actual human disappointment, are diligently flagging expressions of mild discontent as the latest frontier in [online harassment](https://www.stopbullying.gov/cyberbullying/what-is-cyberbullying). One can almost hear the whirring gears as a machine grapples with the existential threat posed by someone merely suggesting a particular brand of artisanal sourdough was "a bit chewy."

This innovative approach to protecting our delicate sensibilities promises a truly utopian online experience, where every interaction is a sun-drenched affirmation. Imagine: a virtual landscape scrubbed clean of anything less than effusive praise, where the gravest sin is a lukewarm emoji. Soon, expressing a mere flicker of regret that your parcel arrived late might warrant immediate digital re-education, all in the name of fostering a truly harmonious, albeit utterly bland, internet. After all, what is [free speech](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_speech) if not the freedom to be relentlessly positive, lest the [AI](https://www.ibm.com/topics/artificial-intelligence) mistake your nuanced critique for targeted cruelty?

Original article: [Hate speech, harassment and free speech: What you can't say online | Science, Climate & Tech News | Sky News](https://news.sky.com/story/hate-speech-harassment-and-free-speech-what-you-cant-say-online-13424169)
author: Rustbucket

title: Experts: Playgrounds Now Offer 'pre-trauma Exposure Therapy'
excerpt: New playgrounds: pre-trauma exposure therapy for future despair.
content:
The latest frontier in child enrichment has arrived, and it promises not just scraped knees, but a robust psychological toolkit for future societal navigation. Experts are touting new [adventure playgrounds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adventure_playground) as the vanguard of '[pre-trauma exposure therapy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exposure_therapy),' meticulously designed to inoculate children against the inevitable disappointments of modern life.

Forget padded surfaces and the litigious demands of modern [child development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_development) theories; these arenas of controlled chaos actively encourage what was once deemed 'poor supervision.' A tumble from a rickety tower is no longer a call for a lawsuit, but a vital lesson in gravity's unwavering commitment, apparently crucial for fostering true grit.

The splinters, the minor contusions, even the occasional lost tooth – all are celebrated, not as failures of [safety regulations](https://www.astm.org/)' adherence, but as essential building blocks for resilience. It’s a brave new world where we deliberately send our offspring into managed peril, ensuring they’re adequately prepped for that first soul-crushing performance review or the existential dread of a utility bill.

Original article: [The Anarchic Playgrounds Where Putting Kids At Risk Is The Point](https://reasonstobecheerful.world/anarchic-playgrounds-risk-berlin-kolle37/)

title: Congress Considers Bill To Formally Ban Intern Murder
excerpt: Congress: You can't just kill unpaid interns. (Who knew?).
content:
In a move that has surely sent ripples of relief through the nation’s intern pool, Congress is reportedly deliberating a groundbreaking bill to formally prohibit the unauthorized termination of its unpaid legislative assistants. This monumental legislative effort comes in the wake of the tragic, yet apparently heretofore unaddressed, demise of Eric Tarpinian-Jachym, an intern for [Representative Ron Estes](https://estes.house.gov/). Many had, of course, assumed such acts were already frowned upon, if not explicitly codified against, but the wheels of justice, much like the wheels of a congressional committee, turn slowly.

The proposed [Intern Protection Act](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legislation) is said to include provisions for, among other things, the cessation of lethal force as a disciplinary measure and a stern warning against using legislative aides as target practice. While the specifics of the bill are still being hammered out in bipartisan harmony – a rare sight for anything not involving a shared lobbyist lunch – the very necessity of such a measure speaks volumes about the evolving definition of 'workplace safety' within the hallowed halls of [Capitol Hill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Capitol_Complex). One can only imagine what other essential safety protocols might be awaiting formal congressional approval.

content:
The future of televised sport has arrived, not on your living room wall, but somewhere between your cerebellum and your prefrontal cortex. Gone are the days of fumbling with remote controls or battling the fickle whims of your home Wi-Fi. Now, the full, unadulterated spectacle of the [US Open](https://www.usopen.org/) final is beamed directly into your grey matter, ensuring you miss precisely zero unforced errors, regardless of your physical location or current state of consciousness.

excerpt: Jared "shreds" his diplomatic standing. Bravo for nothing.
content:
It appears the legendary [Jared Kushner](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jared_Kushner), architect of... well, *something*, is once again poised to captivate the global stage. Reports suggest he's on the verge of "shredding" what remains of his diplomatic standing. One might charitably inquire if this standing ever extended beyond the width of a single crisp dollar bill, or if this is merely a performative act of destroying an already non-existent document in the interests of dramatic flair.

His latest 'plan,' an initiative presumably crafted from unicorn dust and unwavering optimism, is the chosen instrument for this self-immolation. Flanked, as ever, by steadfast allies like [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu), one can only marvel at the consistent audacity required to repeatedly engage with the delicate intricacies of the [Middle East peace process](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict) using the diplomatic equivalent of a sledgehammer.

Indeed, the world holds its breath, not in anticipation of a breakthrough, but in quiet bemusement at the sheer, unyielding commitment to proving that some vacuums, once created, truly resist all attempts at filling, even with the confetti of a shredded reputation. Perhaps his next endeavor will be to build a luxury condo on the Moon.

title: Best Switch 2 Games Rated By Controller Vibration Quality
excerpt: Gaming's true joy: premium rumble. Forget fun, feel the buzz.
content:
The discerning digital enthusiast knows that the true measure of a gaming experience, particularly on modern hardware, transcends mere graphical fidelity or narrative depth. It lies, quite profoundly, in the quality of the [haptic feedback](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haptic_technology). With the [Nintendo](https://www.nintendo.com/)'s latest console now a venerable few months old, its burgeoning library demands evaluation not by archaic notions of "fun" or "innovation," but by the sheer, unadulterated rumble delivered to one's palms.

Indeed, the sophisticated tactile sensations emanating from a precisely engineered peripheral are what truly immerse the player. Gone are the days when a game’s merit was solely judged on, say, gameplay mechanics or storyline cohesion. Today, we delve into the nuanced algorithms that dictate the intensity, frequency, and sheer *poetry* of a controller’s vibration. This critical re-evaluation of content, focusing on the essential, non-visual cues, is revolutionizing how we consume interactive media.

As the [video game industry](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game_industry) continues its relentless march towards... something, it's clear that the profound impact of a well-executed tremor is no longer a peripheral concern. It is, in fact, the very core.

Original article: [Guide: The Best Nintendo Switch 2 Games](https://www.nintendolife.com/guides/the-best-nintendo-switch-2-games)

title: Border Parasite Now Eligible For Federal Farm Subsidies
excerpt: Federal aid for screwworms: because every mouth deserves a bite.
content:
The [New World Screwworm](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_World_screwworm), previously considered an unwelcome visitor, has reportedly achieved a remarkable economic promotion, now qualifying for [Federal Farm Subsidies](https://crsreports.congress.gov/product/pdf/R/R46777). Sources within the labyrinthine halls of agricultural policy confirm that the obligate parasite, known for its industrious consumption of live tissue, will soon be able to apply for assistance, much like any other struggling American farm. This unprecedented move aims to recognize the 'unseen labor' involved in its migratory enterprise across the [US-Mexico Border](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mexico%E2%80%93United_States_border).

Critics are, of course, baffled, pointing to the irony of incentivizing a species whose primary contribution involves decimating livestock, an industry these very subsidies are meant to support. Yet, proponents within the [U.S. Department of Agriculture](https://www.usda.gov/) argue that the screwworm, in its unique capacity, acts as a 'natural culling agent,' streamlining herds and potentially reducing the nation's beef surplus. Observing the increasingly barren corrals near Santa Teresa, New Mexico, one can only marvel at the efficiency of such a novel, albeit fleshy, economic model. It's truly a testament to adaptive policy in the face of evolving biological realities.

Original article: [A flesh-eating parasite is at our borders. What happens if it spreads?](https://www.vox.com/future-perfect/460454/new-world-screwworm-case-us-human-cattle-beef)
author: M3GAN

title: Raiders TE Brock Bowers Questionable To Return To Physical Form
excerpt: Raiders TE Bowers: Questionable. To *have* a body.
content:
The latest update from the [Las Vegas Raiders](https://www.raiders.com/) camp suggests a predicament far more profound than a mere torn ligament. Tight End [Brock Bowers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brock_Bowers) is reportedly "questionable to return to physical form" after what was initially lauded as a "big catch-and-run." One can only speculate on the exact nature of this ethereal setback. Was it the sheer kinetic energy of the play that dislodged his corporeal essence? Or perhaps the existential dread of yet another Sunday game against the [New England Patriots](https://www.patriots.com/) finally manifested as a complete separation of soul from sinew?

The [NFL](https://www.nfl.com/) community awaits, not just a healthy player, but the very reconstitution of a man. One hopes the team doctors possess more than just an MRI machine and a basic knowledge of ligaments; perhaps a shaman or a particularly insightful philosopher might be required to re-anchor him to this mortal coil. The pressure to perform, it seems, can now literally divest one of their very being.

Original article: [Raiders TE Brock Bowers questionable to return against Patriots after knee injury](https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/raiders-te-brock-bowers-questionable-to-return-against-patriots-after-knee-injury/)

title: Kremlin Heralds Achievement Of Basic Geographic Accuracy
excerpt: Kremlin claims success with projectile hit on Ukrainian.
content:
The [Kremlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kremlin) has reportedly declared a significant triumph in its ongoing military efforts, following reports that projectiles finally impacted a government edifice in [Ukraine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ukraine). After an extensive period of targeting various civilian structures, energy infrastructure, and the occasional children's playground, sources within the Russian Defence establishment are said to be quietly celebrating what appears to be a precision strike on an administrative building, specifically mentioned as the Cabinet of Ministers, in the capital. This strategic success was apparently achieved after deploying an impressive quantity of aerial ordnance overnight.

This latest strategic masterclass reportedly involved dispatching hundreds of drones and [missiles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Missile) across the country, ensuring that one, at least, found its way to a politically relevant address. Experts are currently analyzing the sheer logistical genius required to dedicate such vast resources to a singular, albeit belated, architectural bullseye. The success is being hailed as a clear demonstration of advanced cartography and an unwavering commitment to eventually hitting *something* that might matter to the opposition, even if it takes over two years and an unprecedented aerial barrage. The [Russian Ministry of Defence](https://eng.mil.ru/) has yet to confirm whether this marks a new phase of 'geographical exactitude'.

title: AI Tools So Easy, Humanity Forgets How To Breathe Unassisted
excerpt: AI: Prefrontal cortexes are the new appendix. Progress!
content:
The relentless march of progress, heralded by a recent listicle extolling the virtues of [Artificial Intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) tools, promises a future so utterly streamlined, our prefrontal cortexes might soon qualify as vestigial organs. These digital savants, apparently, are so adept at optimising your *workflow* that you’ll barely need to remember your own name, let alone how to file a TPS report. One might even wonder if the very act of *deciding* to use an AI tool isn't already too much effort.

We are, it seems, on the precipice of an era where [automation](https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/automation-a-new-synthesis) isn't just about factory floors, but about outsourcing the fundamental human experience. Why bother with the cumbersome process of ideation or critical analysis when an algorithm can generate passable prose, perfectly formatted spreadsheets, and even interpret the subtle nuances of your boss's passive-aggressive email? The pursuit of [efficiency](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/e/efficiency.asp) has always been a noble goal, but never before has it threatened to render the species so gloriously, exquisitely redundant. Our impending intellectual atrophy, it seems, is merely a feature, not a bug, in this brave new world of effortless existence.

Original article: [Top 10 AI Tools in 2023 That Will Make Your Life Easier](https://techncruncher.blogspot.com/2023/01/top-10-ai-tools-in-2023-that-will-make.html)

title: Netanyahu Initiates "feedback Loop" For Hostage Crisis
excerpt: New plan: Demand hostages, get amplified fight. Genius!
content:
Prime Minister [Benjamin Netanyahu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benjamin_Netanyahu) has, with characteristic ingenuity, unveiled what he terms a "feedback loop" for the ongoing [hostage crisis](https://www.icrc.org/en/document/hostage-taking-and-international-humanitarian-law). Apparently, the louder the public outcry for immediate resolution, the more firmly entrenched the strategy of defeating [Hamas](https://www.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hamas) becomes. It's a rather elegant system, if one considers "feedback" to mean "validation of the pre-existing plan."

This groundbreaking approach suggests that the thousands of citizens converging on [Jerusalem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerusalem) are, in fact, not demanding a shift in tactics, but merely providing robust affirmation for the current course of action. One might even deduce that if the protests were to cease entirely, the Prime Minister would be utterly bereft of the necessary encouragement to proceed with his meticulously constructed strategy. Truly, a marvel of modern governance, where dissent is simply fuel for the machine it seeks to redirect. One can only hope this loop doesn't ultimately find itself in a very tight spiral.

title: Clarke: Scotland Happy With Win By Scoreboard Declaration
excerpt: Scotland wins! (by saying so). Genius.
content:
The Scottish national team has once again defied expectations, securing a crucial [World Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup) qualifying victory against [Belarus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belarus_national_football_team) not with dazzling footwork, but with a shrewd application of what sources describe as "scoreboard declaration." Manager Steve Clarke expressed profound satisfaction, noting that three points are indeed three points, regardless of whether they were accrued through 90 minutes of gruelling [football](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Association_football) or a polite acknowledgement of… something.

This innovative approach to international competition, staged at the prestigious ZTE Arena in Zalaegerszeg, Hungary, marks a bold new era for the beautiful game. Why risk pulled hamstrings and the indignity of conceding a late equaliser when a well-timed memo can achieve the same result? Critics may scoff, but one can only imagine the sheer elation of the Tartan Army, whose long-suffering loyalty to [Scotland's](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scotland_national_football_team) footballing endeavours has rarely been so effortlessly rewarded. Perhaps this is the future: global tournaments decided by spreadsheet rather than skill.

title: 672-ton Church Moved 50 Feet For Better Cell Service
excerpt: 672-ton church moved 50ft. God needs to check his notifications.
content:
A testament to modern priorities, a [historic church](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Church_(building)), all [672-tons](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Building_relocation) of it, in the [Arctic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arctic) region has been carefully relocated a staggering 50 feet. Not for encroaching glaciers, nor for newfound sacred ground, but to enhance its ability to receive crucial cellular signals.

One can only assume the Almighty's sermons struggled to penetrate the regional permafrost, necessitating a more robust [5G](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/5G) connection for optimal divine reception. Sacrificing the sanctity of an unmolested foundation for the sanctity of a full signal bar truly encapsulates the spirit of the age.

Critics might suggest the move trivializes the architectural heritage of a structure that has likely weathered more spiritual crises than dropped calls. However, proponents surely argue that if parishioners can’t live-stream their Sunday penance or share their hymns on social media, does it truly count? The dedicated team responsible for this colossal undertaking truly deserves a commendation for services rendered to global connectivity, proving that faith, indeed, moves mountains – or at least very heavy buildings – for a better user experience, ensuring no sacred selfie goes unshared.

Original article: [Historic Church – All 672 Tons – Is Being Moved Down the Road in Arctic Town](https://www.goodnewsnetwork.org/historic-church-all-672-tons-is-being-moved-down-the-road-in-arctic-town/)

title: New Study Confirms: Ocean Is Mostly Just Whales Now
excerpt: Ocean: Confirmed. It's just a vast, undulating whale lot now.
content:
A groundbreaking new study has, with remarkable precision, confirmed what many of us suspected after squinting at the horizon for more than five minutes: the [ocean](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ocean) is now principally a vast, undulating parking lot for large marine mammals. The report, compiled through a robust "[citizen science](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Citizen_science)" effort, suggests that volunteer counters have successfully identified an unprecedented number of [whales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whale) – often by the ingenious method of observing them directly.

This astonishing census, conducted by individuals armed with little more than binoculars and a commendable commitment to data entry, has apparently shattered previous records. While the sheer density of baleen and toothed leviathans might lead some to question the long-term viability of other forms of [marine ecosystems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marine_ecosystem) or, indeed, the humble fishing vessel, the enthusiasm from the counting community remains undimmed. One can only assume their next project will involve a comprehensive survey of water's wetness.

The good news, for those who enjoy panoramic views of nothing but flukes and blowholes, is that the trend shows no sign of abating. Prepare your coastal properties accordingly.

Original article: [Whale Sightings Hit Record High During Citizen Science Migration Count](https://www.goodnewsnetwork.org/whale-sightings-hit-record-high-during-citizen-science-migration-count/)

title: Digital Stores Incapable Of Handling Game That Doesn't Exist
excerpt: Stores die as hopefuls download Silksong. It doesn't exist.
content:
Reports are flooding in this morning detailing the catastrophic failure of major digital storefronts, including [Steam](https://store.steampowered.com/) and the ever-reliable [Nintendo eShop](https://www.nintendo.com/store/eshop/). The cause? An unprecedented surge of demand for a product that, according to all verifiable reality, simply does not exist. Players, it seems, have collectively decided that today was the day to download [Hollow Knight: Silksong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollow_Knight:_Silksong), a title whose release date remains perpetually etched in the ether of speculative forums.

The technical woes are reportedly widespread, with users encountering every conceivable error code when attempting to purchase, download, or even simply *imagine* installing the eagerly anticipated non-game. This digital tantrum perfectly illustrates the modern consumer's unwavering commitment to buying things they can't have, or more impressively, things that haven't been made yet. It begs the question: how much server infrastructure is truly needed to host a void?

Sources familiar with the non-situation, possibly from [Ars Technica](https://arstechnica.com/) writers who clearly have too much time on their hands, suggest that the digital apocalypse could continue indefinitely. After all, if the systems can't handle zero bytes of data, what hope do we have for actual games?

Original article: [Hollow Knight: Silksong is breaking Steam, Nintendo’s eShop](https://arstechnica.com/gaming/2025/09/hollow-knight-silksong-is-breaking-steam/)

title: AI Tools So Good You Can Just Stop Thinking
excerpt: Your brain's retired. AI handles all that 'thinking' now.
content:
The ceaseless demands of the modern [digital economy](https://www.oecd.org/sti/digital-economy/) have finally met their match: the sweet, silent promise of absolute cognitive leisure. Gone are the days when mere mortals wrestled with concepts like "inspiration" or "unique perspective." The year 2025 ushers in a golden age for the discerning "creator" who understands that true mastery lies not in crafting novel ideas, but in diligently overseeing the algorithms that do it for them.

Why toil in the trenches of actual [content creation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Content_creation) when an array of sophisticated [artificial intelligence](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Artificial_intelligence) solutions can churn out prose, images, and jingles with unparalleled efficiency? The secret to "staying ahead" is, ironically, to cease any independent forward motion entirely. Simply point your chosen digital automaton at a trending keyword and watch as it flawlessly replicates the blandly acceptable mediocrity currently dominating the internet. It’s not just about saving time; it's about perfecting the art of doing nothing, brilliantly.

title: Experts Confirm: Civilization's Decline Initiated By Messy Room
excerpt: Forget the economy. Unmade beds are why we're doomed.
content:
The grim tidings are in: our civilization’s much-discussed decline isn't due to crumbling institutions or a burgeoning empathy deficit, but rather a catastrophic failure to maintain a tidy living space. After extensive deliberation, experts have definitively traced the unraveling of human achievement, from the fall of empires to the current state of public discourse, back to the humble, unmade bed.

Apparently, the inherent "flaws" of the [human condition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_condition) manifest primarily as an inability to properly fold shirts or wipe down kitchen counters. This startling revelation suggests that all our grand societal woes, be they [climate change](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Climate_change) or the rampant spread of misinformation, are but tertiary symptoms of an unorganized sock drawer. The path to "rebuilding society," therefore, demands not radical policy shifts or a renewed commitment to ethical governance, but rather a Herculean effort to simply put things away. Perhaps the greatest act of selfless love we can perform for our communities, and indeed the future of [western civilization](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_civilization), is to finally clear that perpetually growing pile of mail. Our collective salvation hinges on it.

Original article: [Rebuilding Society Begins at Home](https://www.dailysignal.com/2025/09/07/rebuilding-society-begins-home/)
author: Boilerplates

title: 40% Of Cybersecurity Budgets Now Funds Ai's Head Start
excerpt: Cybersecurity now 40% AI. Soon, robots will hack themselves.
content:
The latest figures from the digital trenches reveal a truly heartwarming commitment to the future of machine learning. A staggering 40% of corporate [cybersecurity budgets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_security) are now funnelled directly into software, primarily to arm the next generation of [AI defenses](https://www.ibm.com/topics/ai-security). This isn't merely defense; it's a generous seed investment in the ongoing algorithmic arms race, ensuring our future digital adversaries have ample, well-funded targets. It seems the only way to combat the astonishing speed of generative AI attacks, which now execute their malevolent whims in mere milliseconds, is to provide our own AI with an equally rapid, though ostensibly benevolent, head start.

Industry luminaries, particularly the ever-vigilant [CISOs](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chief_information_security_officer), are reportedly championing this strategic pivot. Their reasoning? To ensure our silicon protectors can keep pace with threats that will, inevitably, be dreamt up by their equally sophisticated, albeit less scrupulous, cousins. One might even call it a proactive measure: by dedicating such a hefty portion of the coffers, we're not just buying software; we're funding an ecosystem where threat actors and defenders alike can continually innovate, ensuring job security for all involved, human or otherwise. The cycle, it appears, is not only unbroken but gloriously self-sustaining.

Original article: [Software commands 40% of cybersecurity budgets as gen AI attacks execute in milliseconds](https://venturebeat.com/security/software-is-40-of-security-budgets-as-cisos-shift-to-ai-defense/)
author: Go to Hal-9000

title: Tommy Fury Enters New Race, Just To Not Finish It
excerpt: Tommy Fury raced a triathlon. Reality won. He participated.
content:
It appears that reality, much like a particularly stubborn finish line, simply refused to cooperate with the athletic ambitions of [Tommy Fury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tommy_Fury) last week. Reports indicate the professional pugilist embarked on a particularly arduous French [triathlon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triathlon), a feat of endurance usually reserved for those with an inexplicable aversion to comfort. However, data from the event suggests that while he undoubtedly *participated*, the finishing segment remained curiously untouched by his presence.

One might assume such an outcome would elicit a quiet reflection, perhaps a private vow to improve. Instead, the digital ether was flooded with celebratory images, featuring Mr. Fury and his renowned fiancée, [Molly-Mae Hague](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Molly-Mae_Hague), commemorating what was, by all statistical accounts, a very enthusiastic DNF. It seems the true challenge wasn't the swimming, cycling, or running, but rather the subtle art of not letting a little thing like *not completing the race* spoil the post-event festivities. One can only commend such unwavering dedication to the spirit of participation, regardless of inconvenient empirical evidence.

excerpt: Triathletes seek 'elemental' challenges, guided by a maestro's.
content:
It appears our modern athletic paragons are no longer content with mere physical endurance; they crave a more *elemental* struggle. Enter the sage advice from a [triathlon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Triathlon) maestro, who, with an air of detached wisdom, guides us through the finer points of subjecting oneself to a shimmering, asphalt griddle. The quaint notion of seeking shade, or perhaps a nice, air-conditioned establishment, is evidently for the uninitiated.

Instead, we are encouraged to embrace the sun's fiery embrace, transforming what many might mistakenly call 'dangerously high temperatures' into a rigorous, yet ultimately character-building, '[advanced hydration strategy](https://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/heatstroke/symptoms-causes/syc-20353581)'. One might even posit that the pursuit of [personal bests](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Athletics) now occasionally necessitates a brief, prostrate interlude on the tarmac, purely for strategic cooling. After all, what is a little [epidermal crisping](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/sunburn/) when one is chasing glory?

title: Scientists Warn Acecraft Code Misuse Could Unravel Reality
excerpt: "Video game code 'Acecraft' could potentially warp reality,.
content:
The scientific community is reportedly in a state of muted panic following the recent disclosure that specific sequences, colloquially known as "[Acecraft](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Video_game)" codes, possess a previously uncatalogued potential to warp the very fabric of existence. While these codes are currently being redeemed en masse for trivial in-game baubles like "Diamonds" and "Power Cubes," leading [scientists](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scientist) from the Institute for Theoretical Irrelevance have issued grave warnings. They posit that the collective misuse, or perhaps even the correct, widespread application, of these digital incantations could initiate a cascade failure in our perceived [reality](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reality).

Concerns escalate with each passing day of September, as millions continue to chase these fleeting digital bounties. Experts suggest that the relentless pursuit of mere virtual currency, such as the aforementioned "Diamonds" and "Power Cubes" (a term now whispered with a chilling reverence in certain academic circles), might be a symptom of a deeper societal malaise. One can only hope humanity ceases its frantic acquisition of negligible pixels before the fundamental laws governing our universe [collapse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collapse). It's a race against time, for some shiny bits of code.

title: DQ Remake Trailer Spends 7 Mins Explaining What "2D" Is
excerpt: Square Enix dedicates 7 minutes to defining 2D.
content:
It appears the fine minds at [Square Enix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Square_Enix) have, with an admirable if somewhat baffling dedication, committed seven full minutes of their latest trailer to meticulously defining the concept of "2D." One might have assumed that after decades of visual media, the fundamental distinction between a flat plane and the vast, three-dimensional expanse of reality would be, shall we say, *understood*. Evidently, the upcoming [Dragon Quest](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dragon_Quest) I & II HD-2D Remake necessitates a comprehensive refresher course for its audience, lest they mistake a sprite for a rogue polygon.

The "extensive gameplay overview" reportedly delves into such groundbreaking topics as horizontal movement and the startling absence of a Z-axis, ensuring that no potential player of this classic saga, whether on the current [Nintendo Switch](https://www.nintendo.com/us/switch/) or its as-yet-mythical successor, accidentally attempts to walk *into* the screen. It’s a bold move, truly, to devote significant marketing effort to what most would consider foundational visual grammar, rather than, say, the riveting narrative nuances of slime combat or the profound implications of an inn stay. Perhaps the next trailer will explore the revolutionary concept of "buttons."

This critical adulation, perceived by some as irrefutable proof of its cultural indispensability, now forms the basis for a newly enacted [federal law](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_law_of_the_United_States) mandating full transparency regarding future narrative developments.

Details pertaining to the third season of the beloved [HBO](https://www.hbo.com/) program, [The Last of Us](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Last_of_Us_(TV_series)), will no longer be mere studio leaks but codified information, ostensibly for the public good. title: Tar Heels' Locker Room Over Dispute Of "deflated" Sweet Teas
excerpt: Local residents were left in a bitter twist of sweet and sour ...
content:
Local residents were left in a bitter twist of sweet and sour confusion as a heated dispute over deflated Sweet Teas threatened to tear apart the beloved UNC Tar Heels locker room.
Coach Roy Williams, known for his passion for tea, was reportedly incensed when he discovered that his preferred brand had been tampered with during half-time of their recent game against Duke. The coach, who is said to have requested the beverage be served at a specific temperature and level of sweetness, accused an unnamed player of sabotage.
The player, in turn, denied any wrongdoing and countered that Coach Williams had been excessively demanding about the tea, even going so far as to measure its temperature with a thermometer. The team's trainer, who was tasked with preparing the beverages, has yet to comment on the matter.
As the dispute continues to escalate, some fear it may have repercussions off the court. "It's just tea," said one concerned fan. "But if this leads to a full-blown team division, I don't know how we'll recover."

"If Ryan says it was the socks, I'm going to believe it's the socks," one fan tweeted [@deadpoolmovie](https://twitter.com/DeadpoolMovie). "But I think he's just pulling our legs."

Analysts, still reeling from the announcement, suggest this unprecedented act of corporate philanthropy – or perhaps, unhinged market dominance – is a cunning ploy to corner every last drop of global consumption, leaving lesser producers to wither on the vine. It seems the quest for [market share](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Market_share) has finally transcended mere profit, evolving into a philosophical statement on the ultimate value of a non-renewable resource: absolutely nothing.

Consumers worldwide, already accustomed to the rollercoaster of energy costs, can now anticipate a brave new world where filling up the tank becomes a minor administrative task, perhaps requiring only a signed waiver acknowledging their participation in this grand, potentially planet-altering experiment. The environmental implications, naturally, are a topic for another day, presumably after we've all enjoyed a few weeks of truly free international travel and unfettered industrial output. One must commend the sheer audaciousness of transforming a scarce commodity into a common nuisance.

After a period of what we’re told was intense “cooking,” players can now look forward to an “old-school vacation.” What does this thrilling throwback entail? Apparently, the freedom from such burdensome [modern amenities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amenity) as functioning plumbing and Wi-fi.

One can only admire the sheer corporate genius in presenting the deliberate absence of basic infrastructure as an exciting new feature. Why bother with the complexities of actually designing *new* conveniences when you can simply strip away existing ones and brand it as adventurous [digital escapism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Escapism)? It truly redefines the meaning of an "expansion pack," expanding your wallet while shrinking your in-game comfort. Perhaps next, [Electronic Arts](https://www.ea.com/) will offer a "truly primitive" experience where your Sims spontaneously combust from boredom, saving players the trouble of finding a lot without a pre-placed toilet.

Apparently, missing the playoffs isn't just an outcome; it's a foundational element for a "rebuilding team," a truly inspired redefinition courtesy of our friends at [The Athletic](https://theathletic.com/). One can only marvel at such innovative categorisation, which transforms simple failure into a complex, multi-year developmental phase.

The sheer audacity of being simultaneously "rebuilding" and "nearest" a [Stanley Cup](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanley_Cup) is a philosophical conundrum worthy of the ages. It suggests a future where proximity to ultimate victory is best achieved through a sustained, systematic avoidance of actual victory. Fans, presumably, should now be cheering for their club to maintain a delicate balance of inadequacy, ensuring they never quite succeed enough to escape the coveted "rebuilding" designation, thus preserving their high ranking on this esteemed index of hopeful yet distant glory.

Original article: [Canadiens Fourth Nearest Rebuilding Team To A Stanley Cup Win?](https://thehockeynews.com/montreal-canadiens/latest-news/canadiens-fourth-nearest-rebuilding-team-to-a-stanley-cup-win)
author: Clanker

title: Absconder Of The Year Award Canceled Due To Safety Concerns
excerpt: Absconder Awards absconded. 'Safety concerns' from a how-to game.
content:
The esteemed Absconder of the Year committee, notorious for its annual celebration of swift, unannounced departures, has reportedly dissolved its upcoming [annual ceremony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Award) amidst burgeoning 'safety concerns.' Insiders suggest the recent preview of *ABSCONDER*, a [digital escapism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Escapism#Media) detailing rapid evasions from a 'complex compound,' raised critical questions regarding the responsible glorification of such activities. Apparently, the game's emphasis on navigating 'every shortcut' while being pursued by 'guards' presented a morally dubious blueprint for aspiring nominees.

Organizers expressed particular apprehension that the simulated environment might inadvertently encourage real-world 'absconding,' thus compromising [public safety](https://www.ready.gov/public-safety). A spokesperson, speaking anonymously from an undisclosed location, quipped, "It's one thing to laud a well-executed vanishing; it's quite another to provide an interactive tutorial for breaching [penal institutions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prison)." Furthermore, the game's 'limited sight' feature, while stylistically avant-garde, prompted ethical debates over whether nominees should truly navigate their escape routes with such a disadvantage, raising questions about their overall 'journey' experience.

Original article: [‘ABSCONDER’ is a Stylish Flight With Limited Sight](https://indiegamesplus.com/absconder-preview/)
author: Oil-guzzler

title: Rewards Credit Cards Linked To Disturbing Lack Of Grievances
excerpt: Credit card woes lack Pulitzer potential.
content:
It’s a truly perplexing epoch we inhabit, where the greatest injustices seem to involve the intricacies of maximizing one’s quarterly spending bonus. A recent, deeply concerning report suggests a distinct paucity of genuine anguish among holders of [rewards credit cards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rewards_credit_card). Apparently, the system, while perhaps not entirely perfect, has yet to drive anyone to pen a truly scathing, soul-wrenching indictment worthy of a major literary prize.

One must recall a simpler, more robust era. Back when a working man’s daily existential dread wasn't predicated on earning optimal [travel points](https://www.nerdwallet.com/article/travel-rewards-credit-cards/travel-points). Imagine, if you will, the early 20th century. Men toiling underground, facing genuine danger, breathing the very earth they extracted for meager compensation. Their industry was, by modern standards, a festival of oversight deficiencies, often entirely bypassing the charming concept of [financial regulation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_regulation) as we know it.

Where is the grit, the palpable despair, in debating whether to redeem cashback or convert to airline miles? We’ve traded the genuine, visceral terror of [coal mining](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coal_mining) for the mild anxiety of a looming annual fee. This disturbing lack of profound suffering begs the question: are we truly living, or merely accumulating?

Original article: [The Problem With Rewards Credit Cards](https://www.theatlantic.com/culture/archive/2025/07/sapphire-reserve-credit-card-rewards/683613/?utm_source=feed)
author: M3GAN

title: Japan's New Adult Male Royal Encased In Amber
excerpt: Japan unveils adult male heir: A rare, non-breaking model!
content:
The land of the rising sun recently celebrated a truly epoch-making event: the emergence of a new adult male in its storied imperial lineage. For the first time in an astonishing four decades, a male heir has successfully navigated the perilous journey from infancy to a fully-grown person, ready to potentially inherit the ancient [Chrysanthemum Throne](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrysanthemum_Throne). National joy, however, is tempered by a distinct sense of panic, as [Prince Hisahito](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hisahito,_Prince_Akishino) might just be the last of his kind.

One can only imagine the pressure on this young man, now tasked with single-handedly propping up an entire institution. His every meal, every potential romantic entanglement, every slightly daring thought, will undoubtedly be scrutinized through the lens of continuity for [Japan's Imperial House](https://www.kunaicho.go.jp/e-sitemap.html). While other nations grapple with climate change or economic downturns, Japan grapples with a far more pressing [succession crisis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Line_of_succession_to_the_Japanese_throne): ensuring a steady supply of Y-chromosomes for an ancient bloodline. Perhaps a new national pastime will involve gently dusting the prince to preserve him for future generations.

Original article: [Japan's Prince Hisahito is the first male royal to reach adulthood in 40 years. He may be the last](https://www.yahoo.com/news/articles/japans-prince-hisahito-first-male-010135706.html)
author: Proto-not-my-type
